fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Importer for Bitbucket Server repository fetches data from Bitbucket Server instance. This is not possible when in RSS mode, since that process works without user context
In BAM-18934, the workaround was to 
bq. Create a linked repository and use it in a plan
Then, in Bamboo 6.3.0, we released the fix, which was:
bq. to make it possible to avoid communication with Bitbucket Server while importing a repository. In order to do that, user must specify ssh public key, ssh private key and ssh clone url when in Bamboo Specs.
If users don't want to expose their SSH keys, the fix requires them to use a Git repository instead of Bitbucket Server.
h3. Suggested Solution
Improve this pipeline so that users can create Bitbucket Server repos through RSS without specifying keys or Shared credentials.

h3. Why this is important
Users are reporting that this fix is relatively cumbersome, and any alternative would mean losing the Bitbucket Server applink functionality.
fields.summary: Improve Plan level Bitbucket Server repository creation from RSS

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting a Plan to Specs that includes the Docker Task, it will fail if any of the Username, Password, or Email is set, and the Username and/or Password are blank on the Docker Task when the Command is set to *Pull* or *Push a Docker image to a Docker registry*. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a Build Plan with a Docker Task
# Set the *Command* option to *Push a Docker image to a Docker registry*
# Set "Email" only in the Credentials section
# View Plan as Bamboo Specs

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo Specs representation will appear

h3. Actual Results
The export fails, and the following error appears in the UI:
{noformat}Docker Push/Pull image task:: Argument username can not be blank.{noformat}

The below exception is also thrown in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log}} file:
{noformat}
2018-01-05 22:32:28,942 ERROR [http-nio-8085-exec-2] [ViewPlanSpecs] Docker Push/Pull image task:: Argument username can not be blank.
com.atlassian.bamboo.specs.api.exceptions.PropertiesValidationException: Docker Push/Pull image task:: Argument username can not be blank.
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.specs.api.validators.common.ImporterUtils.checkNotBlank(ImporterUtils.java:142)
	... (truncated)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround 
Remove email from the Docker configuration
fields.summary: Remove email from condition to check for non-null username/password in Docker task Specs export
Multiple links missing on YAML tutorial for specs

fields.description:
h2. HTR

It's not easy to reproduce by normal application usage. Issue may occur on heavy app load. However, it's easy to reproduce the problem by SQL manipulation.
# Create plan with at least one test case
# Add this test to quarantine
# Use SQL to duplicate this test case in DB (test_case table)
# Run build
# Remove quarantine for this test
# Run build

h2. Expected behavior 

Test is no longer quarantined

h2. Actual behavior

Removing quarantine action removed the quarantine from the newest test case in DB. The duplicated entity has still quarantine properties set and because of that quarantine for given test case is still in place. It's not possible to change that state via UI. 

Quarantine processor should take into consideration only the newest test case or unleashing test should either remove quarantine properties from all test cases with given name and job (including duplicated ones). (Both perhaps?) 

h2. Workaround

Use [REST|https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-bamboo/REST/6.3.0/#d2e116] to remove quarantine for duplicated test case.
fields.summary: When Test Case entity is duplicated user can't turn off Quarantine for that particular entity

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A Bamboo plan will fail to download a shared artifact from another plan that was created/updated by RSS, and having the RSS build as latest build.

h3. Environment
Bamboo 6.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two linked repositories in Bitbucket, "rep1" and "rep2"
# Create two plans in Bamboo, "plan1" and "plan2", associated to the previous repositories respectively.
# plan2 will generate a shared artifact.
# plan1 will download the previous artifact with the task "Artifact download".
# Create a RSS repository to manage at least plan2.
# Make a change in plan2 (in the Java code) to force a RSS build.
# Build plan1

h3. Expected Results
plan1 will run successfully.

h3. Actual Results
plan1 will throw the following error:
{noformat}
simple	04-Jan-2018 09:01:44	Preparing to download plan result PRJ-PS2-3 artifact: Shared artifact: [arti], pattern: [artifact.txt]
error	04-Jan-2018 09:01:44	Unable to download artifact Shared artifact: [arti], pattern: [artifact.txt]
{noformat}
since the RSS build doesn't include the artifact.

h3.Workaround
After a RSS build for plan2, build plan2 manually to force a new generation of an artifact.
fields.summary: A Bamboo plan will fail to download a shared artifact from another plan that was created/updated by RSS, and having the RSS build as latest build.

h3. Summary
When a build is Stopped during Source Code Checkout, file locks are not removed, requiring a Bamboo restart to rerun builds

* Windows

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start a build
# Stop it during checkout
# Try to rerun the build

h3. Expected Results
Build runs successfully

h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the {{atlassian-bamboo.log}} file:
{noformat}
2017-09-22 09:47:39,216 WARN [16-BAM::Default Agent::Agent:pool-31-thread-1] [VcsCheckoutTask] PROJ-PLAN-JOB1-123: Unable to clean source directory '<build-working-directory>' <build-working-directory>\src
java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException: <build-working-directory>\src
	at sun.nio.fs.WindowsFileSystemProvider.implDelete(Unknown Source)
	at sun.nio.fs.AbstractFileSystemProvider.delete(Unknown Source)
	at java.nio.file.Files.delete(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.utils.BambooFiles.delete(BambooFiles.java:43)
...
Caused by: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Unable to clean source directory '<build-working-directory>\' <build-working-directory>\src

Caused by: java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException: <build-working-directory>\src

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On Windows, if Bamboo Home contains spaces, the RSS Maven will fail
h3. Environment
* Windows
* Repository Stored Specs

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Bamboo Home in {{C:\Users\My User\bamboo-home}}
# Setup and run repository Stored Specs

h3. Expected Results
Specs runs as expected
h3. Actual Results
The below exception is thrown in the job log:
{noformat}
C:\Users\My Username\bamboo-home\xml-data\build-dir\serverSide\REPOSITORY_STORED_SPECS\path\to\RSS\dir>"C:\Program Files\Bamboo\tools\apache-maven-3.5.0\bin\mvn.cmd" --batch-mode --file C:\Users\My Username\bamboo-home\xml-data\build-dir\serverSide\REPOSITORY_STORED_SPECS\path\to\RSS\dir\specs12345678.xml -Ppublish-specs -Dspecs.yamlDir=C:\Users\My Username\bamboo-home\xml-data\build-dir\serverSide\REPOSITORY_STORED_SPECS\path\to\output -Dspecs.useRest=false -Dspecs.useSecurityManager=true -Dspecs.rs.specsSourceId=1212417 -Dmaven.test.skip=true -Dmaven.compiler.fork=false -Dbamboo.specs.version=6.3.0 
POM file C:\Users\My specified the -f/--file command-line argument does not exist 
....
2017-12-29 16:45:38,747 ERROR [AtlassianEvent::0-BAM::EVENTS:pool-1-thread-9] [AsynchronousAbleEventDispatcher] There was an exception thrown trying to dispatch event [com.atlassian.stash.plugin.remote.event.StashBranchChangedRemoteEvent@71584c06[branchName=master,repositoryProject=TEST,repositorySlug=test-specs,committer=my.user,sourceId=<hash>,sourceUrl=http://bbserver-url:7990]] from the invoker [SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker{method=public void com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.stash.events.BranchChangedEventListener.onBranchChangedEvent(com.atlassian.stash.plugin.remote.event.StashBranchChangedRemoteEvent), listener=com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.stash.events.BranchChangedEventListener@369a7daa}]
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Unable to scan repository Repository (1234567890) for Bamboo Specs
	at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:54)
	... (truncated)
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Unable to scan repository Repository (1234567890) for Bamboo Specs
	at com.google.common.base.Throwables.propagate(Throwables.java:160)
	... (truncated)
Caused by: com.atlassian.bamboo.repository.RepositoryException: Unable to scan repository Test Specs (425989) for Bamboo Specs
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.configuration.external.RepositoryStoredSpecsServiceImpl.lambda$runSpecsWithMaven$8(RepositoryStoredSpecsServiceImpl.java:727)
	... (truncated)
Caused by: com.atlassian.utils.process.ProcessException: Non-zero exit code: 1
	at com.atlassian.utils.process.PluggableProcessHandler.complete(PluggableProcessHandler.java:69)
	... (truncated)
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
Set Bamboo Home to the short name (DOS 8.3 format).
To find this, you can run the following commands in the Command prompt:
{noformat}
cd C:\Users\
dir /x
{noformat}
For example: {{C:\Users\My Username\bamboo-home}} could be {{C:\Users\MYUSER~1\bamboo-home}}.
Then, update the {{bamboo.home}} value in {{<bamboo-install>\atlassian-bamboo\WEB-INF\classes\bamboo-init.properties}} to the short name.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Bamboo, we see the following message when enabling Clover for a build:
bq. Global Clover license has not been configured. You need to provide license in order to use Clover

h3. Suggested Solution
Either:
* Improve the note to add a mention of integrating Clover into the Build; or
* Remove the license requirement

h3. Why this is important
As Clover is now Open Source, users will be unable to provide licenses, as no new licenses are available

h3. Workaround 
Please integrate Clover into your {{pom.xml}} or {{build.xml}} and then select "Clover is already integrated into this build and a clover.xml file will be produced" when enabling Clover for your Build plan.
Please see the following Community answer for more detail:
* [Clover is open source yet license required for bamboo|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bamboo-questions/Clover-is-open-source-yet-license-required-for-bamboo/qaq-p/694654]
fields.summary: Update Clover license warning message

fields.description:
Since Clover is now Open Source, we can no longer acquire licenses for the application. This means that the documentation for integrating Clover with Bamboo needs to be updated.

Please update the [Using Bamboo with Clover|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/using-bamboo-with-clover-289277349.html] documentation to specify the new open source workflow.

Example:
Using the "Automatically integrate Clover into this build." in the Miscellaneous tab of the Job configuration is available only for users who purchased Clover licenses before it became open source, as their licenses are still valid for some time.

The other option in the Miscellaneous job config is "Clover is already integrated into this build and a clover.xml file will be produced." With this option selected, please add Clover into your pom.xml for Maven to read ([Clover-for-Maven: Basic usage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/clover/basic-usage-588579892.html]), or build.xml for Ant ([Clover-for-Ant: Quickstart guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/clover/1-quickstart-guide-71599501.html]) – the license portions no longer apply.

For Maven, you can add the following Goals to your command (or Maven task):

{noformat}clover:setup 
clover:aggregate 
clover:clover{noformat}
For Ant, you can use the following arguments when calling Ant – and/or in your Ant task:

{noformat}with.clover
clover.xml{noformat}
fields.summary: Update Clover integration documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Application link set with OAuth impersonation breaks Bamboo build status in Bitbucket

h3. Environment
* Bamboo 6.1.4 
* Bamboo 6.1.6
* Bitbucket 5.3.3
* Crowd 2.12.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set app link between Bamboo and Bitbucket on OAuth Impersonation 
# Pull users from Crowd
# Setup a plan using the Bitbucket server repository
# Commit to Bitbucket repository 

h3. Expected Results
# Bitbucket should show the build status notification from Bamboo

h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
[BitbucketServerBuildStatusUpdater] Sending build notification to Stash (build key: XXXXX, repository: XXXXXX)
[RestCallHelper] Failed to send stash build notification via http://bitbucket533:7990 - it has to have OAuth authentication configured.
[BitbucketServerBuildStatusUpdater] Failed to store build status against Stash instance Bitbucket, reason: com.atlassian.bamboo.jira.rest.JiraRestResponse@11101c08[statusCode=2147483647,statusMessage=<null>,errors=Errors[errorMessages=[Failed to send stash build notification via http://bitbucket533:7990 - it has to have OAuth authentication configured.],errors={}],body=<null>,entity=<null>]
[BitbucketServerBuildStatusUpdater] No build status updates have been sent to Stash (build key: XXXXX, repository: XXXXXXX test). Is your application link configured properly?
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
No workaround available if OAuth Impersonation is required. Otherwise don't setup Application Links with OAuth Impersonation.

h3. Notes
Issue is resolved in Bamboo 6.2
fields.summary: Application link with Oauth impersonation breaks Bamboo build status in Bitbucket

fields.description:
Whenever git user/password authentication is used on Windows agent will not be able to successfully authenticate. The best workaround is to switch to ssh authentication or update to newer version.

h2. Workaround
* Stop Bamboo 6.3.0
* Replace atlassian-bamboo-plugin-git-6.3.0.jar with attached  [^atlassian-bamboo-plugin-git-6.3.0-BAM-19587.jar]  at BAMBOO_INSTALL/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins
* Replace atlassian-bamboo-api-6.3.0.jar with attached  [^atlassian-bamboo-api-6.3.0-BAM-19587.jar] at BAMBOO_INSTALL/atlassian-bamboo/WEB-INF/lib
* Start Bamboo 6.3.0
Remote agents will download upgraded jars on next reconnect
fields.summary: Git password authentication on Windows agent doesn't work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As for today, Bamboo logs all events in catalina.out (and atlassian-bamboo.log for Windows instances). This ends up in having massive log files (GBs big) which can become an inconvenience.
h3. Solution

Have Bamboo log in different files, especially access logs (AccessLogFilter), which generates a lot of output.
h3. Notes

Bitbucket has already this implementation running.
fields.summary: Have Bamboo log access (and other log entries) in different files

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Build succeeds even if artifact publishing fails

h3. Environment
* Bamboo v6.2.5

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a plan (_i.e PROJ-PLAN_)
* Add a Script task
{noformat}
ls
{noformat}
* Create a Artifact Definition
||Name||Location||Copy pattern||
|My Artifact| |\*\*/*| 

h3. Expected Results
* Build should fail since there is no artifact to be published.

h3. Actual Results
The following gets displayed in build log:
{noformat}
simple	19-Dec-2017 19:42:50	Publishing an artifact: My Artifact
error	19-Dec-2017 19:42:50	Unable to publish artifact [My Artifact]: 
simple	19-Dec-2017 19:42:50	The artifact hasn't been successfully published after 50.36 ms
{noformat}
And the build succeeds.

h6.One possible workaround to fail the build (bash compatible):
* Have a script task at the end of the build to check if there is any file(artifact) generated or not and fail the build if not.
{code}
cnt=`ls | wc -l`
echo "Count value is: "$cnt
if [ $cnt -lt 1 ] 
then
echo "failing build as no artifacts found"
exit -1
fi
{code}
(!) Please note: The above code is bash compatible and is only for reference (You may have to script it when using Windows or any other OS). You could change this code as per your requirement to look for specific files as well.
fields.summary: Build succeeds when Bamboo is unable to publish artifact

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are unable to effectively rename remote agent from <BAMBOO_AGENT_HOME>/bamboo-agent.cfg.xml.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install remote agent (e.g. following our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/bamboo-remote-agent-installation-guide-289276832.html]).
# Make sure the remote agent connects to Bamboo at least one time. When the remote agent first connects to Bamboo, it sends the hostname as its name, which is then registered and stored in Bamboo's database.
# Stop the remote agent.
# Open up the <BAMBOO_AGENT_HOME>/bamboo-agent.cfg.xml file.
# Change the *<name>* tag to rename the remote agent.
# Start the remote agent.

h3. Expected Results

Bamboo should display the updated remote agent's name in the UI after restarting the agent.

h3. Actual Results

Bamboo continues to display the old agent's name even though the agent logs show the new/updated name. 

h3.Workaround

Right now, to rename the agent and ensure consistency go through the following steps every time you need to rename a remote agent:

# Open up the remote agent *<BAMBOO_AGENT_HOME>/bamboo-agent.cfg.xml* file and change the <name> tag to rename the remote agent.
# From the UI go to the *Bamboo administration > Agents* page.
#* Locate the remote agent from step 1 under the tabs "Online" or "Offline".
#* Click the agent name. You'll get redirected to the remote agent summary page.
#* Click *Edit details*.
#* Use the "Name" field to rename the remote agent.

Basically you'll have to rename the agent in two different places. You'll have to go through steps 1 & 2 to rename the remote agent and ensure that both the *bamboo-agent.cfg.xml* file and the database are in sync.
fields.summary: Unable to rename remote agent from bamboo-agent.cfg.xml
Add the possibility of linking tasks with custom requirements in Specs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A user without global create permission and with full plan rights cannot add a linked repository

h3. Environment
* Bamboo 6.2.2 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set global permission for the user to be view
# Set plan permission to all permissions

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to add a linked repository

h3. Actual Results
User cannot add a linked repository, unless they user is granted with Create Repository in the global permission 

h3.Workaround
grant Create Repository permission to the user
fields.summary: Admin permission to a plan should allow the user to add a linked repository
UI glitch when build number value is longer than 4 digits
bamboo wire format negotiation timeout

h3. Summary
Bamboo remote agent fails to update or install with a {{NullPointerException}} in Bamboo. This occurs when the HTTP response from the Bamboo Server to the agent does not contain the 'Content-Length' HTTP header. This can happen when connecting the agent to Bamboo via a reverse proxy which enables gzip / chunked transfer encoding.


h3. Environment
* Reverse proxy between Bamboo Server and Remote Agent

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable gzip using {{mod_deflate}} on Apache HTTPD for Content-Type {{application/octet-stream}}
{code}
AddOutputFilterByType DEFLATE application/octet-stream
{code}
# Install a new Bamboo remote agent and connect it to the proxied Bamboo Server URL.

Agent installs / updates and connects successfully.

h3.Workaround
* Disable gzip on the reverse proxy for Content-Type: {{application/octet-stream}}. 
** This configuration could be in a number of places but as an example, it could be in your {{deflate.conf}}. Default location on Ubuntu: {{/etc/apache2/mods-enabled/deflate.conf}} -> {{../mods-available/deflate.conf}}
* Or, bypass reverse proxy completely by connecting directly to Bamboo through an unproxied address. The connection URL of the agent is stored in the *<bamboo-agent-home>/conf/wrapper.conf*. Example:
{code}
wrapper.app.parameter.2=http://bamboo:8085/agentServer/
{code}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently Bamboo only supports using it's internal ActiveMQ

h3. Suggested Solution
 Allow and support Bamboo with external ActiveMQ
fields.summary: Support external ActiveMQ in Bamboo

fields.description:
Hi, here is the situation:

 

  When finishing hotfix branches, the branches are deleted and the final commit tagged.

Therefore, no branch remains, but a tag does.

It is not possible to rebuild this commit in Bamboo without creating a branch for it;

Passing the SHA-1 or the tag ref still results in a failure:

 

com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.git.GitCommandException: command /usr/bin/git branch -a --contains b437430c556dede24441557d4f2d11423efdd45c failed with code 129. Working directory was [/data01/bamboo/xml-data/build-dir/_git-repositories-cache/2720121fad1f9fe9ee6d9ea2caa6f79dd36bb873]., stderr: error: no such commit b437430c556dede24441557d4f2d11423efdd45c

 

It is desirable for bamboo to be able to reach these tagged commits without having to create a branch for them.
fields.summary: Bamboo cannot reach commits that are not a branch

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When users access the project summary page and they don't have access to view the plans in it, the message says that there are no plans in the project -- this isn't necessarily true, the user may not have access to those plans.

!current_project_summary.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggestion

Adjust the message to report that the project may be empty but that the user may as well not have permissions to see any plans. For example, something like this:

!new_message.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve "There are no plans in this project" message

fields.summary: Add Bamboo Specs support for trigger conditions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no feature in bamboo to perform automatic retry of failed incomplete builds/jobs or rerun the entire build automatically.

h3. Suggested Solution
Introduce a feature to schedule the automatic restart of failed or incomplete jobs. If a plan continues to fail, even after multiple retries of failed or incomplete jobs multiple times, the feature can schedule a complete rerun of the entire build.
Also, has the option to set a number of tries to trigger the failed or incomplete builds/jobs.

h3. Workaround
Currently, this can be implemented by utilizing the scripting/coding. 
For example: 

Using REST Call for checking build status:
{code}
curl --user <user-name>:<password> -X GET http://robhit-proxy.com/rest/api/latest/result/ATP-ATA/latest

# Here "ATP-ATA" is the key of the plan
{code}

Then using REST Call to trigger a build:

{code}
curl --user <user-name>:<password> -X PUT http://robhit-proxy.com/rest/api/latest/queue/ATP-ATA-buildNumber

# Here "ATP-ATA" is the key of the plan
{code}
fields.summary: Automatic Retry for Bamboo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Plan variables passed from Jira to Bamboo;  One variable will be set to 'undefined' as the variable name instead of properly overrighting the variable value as expected.

When sending from Jira to Bamboo:
variable = xyz
cvariable = abc 

Bamboo receives
variable = xyz
undefined = abc

h3. Environment
* Bamboo
* Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a build plan with at least one Build linked to a Jira issue
# Add the 4 variables above as Plan variables
# Enable DEBUG logging in Jira
# Create a Version in Jira
# Release the version, overriding the variables:
{noformat}testing : bam
gtesting : boo
foobar : foobar
testingh  : test{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
variables set in Jira release sent properly to Bamboo

h3. Actual Results
The below is shown in the logs:
{noformat:title=jira HTTP Log}
2017-12-15 20:24:24,009 http-nio-9080-exec-5 DEBUG admin 1224x1133x1 d5y7ix 127.0.0.1 /secure/SubmitBambooRelease.jspa [o.apache.http.wire] http-outgoing-86 >> "bamboo.triggerReason.jiraProjectName=Elias+Test&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraVersion=v4&bamboo.variable.foobar=foobar&bamboo.variable.undefined=boo&bamboo.variable.testingh=test&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraUsername=admin&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraProjectKey=ET&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraBaseUrl=http%3A%2F%2F<bamboo-url>%3A9080&bamboo.variable.testing=bam&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraVersionId=10003&bamboo.triggerReason.jiraUserDisplayName=Elias+Zeidan&bamboo.customTriggerReasonKey=com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.jira%3AjiraReleaseTriggerReason&bamboo.customPlanTriggerKey=com.atlassian.bamboo.plugin.jira%3AjiraReleasePlanTrigger"
{noformat}
 
{noformat:title=Bamboo Build Log}
Custom variables
Name	Value
jira.projectKey	ET
jira.version	v3
foobar	foobar
jira.projectName	Elias Test
testingh	test
testing	bam
jira.username	admin
jira.baseUrl	<jira-url>
undefined	boo
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Currently the only workaround is to change the variable names to be dissimilar from each other.
fields.summary: environment variable name being set to 'undefined' when passed from Jira under certain cercumstances

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Some users need to be able to install and authenticate remote agents while they're offline. Even the REST API needs the agent to be started so the Server knows the UUID of the agent that is being authenticated.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add/allow offline authentication for remote agents.

h3. Why this is important
Allows agents to be used with automation

h3. Workaround 
Install each agent manually
fields.summary: Ability to install and authenticate offline agent

fields.description:
h3. Description

During the plan creation process if you're logged in as a user with restricted access to the project you're creating a plan in, and can't see whether that project already have plans in it, if you hit the {{Cancel}} button inside the "Configure tasks" screen, an error message is thrown.

h3. Steps to reproduce
h4. First, as an admin
# Create a new project.
# Then create a plan in it.
# Restrict access to that plan so that no else can see the plan you just created.
# Create a user (_e.g. user01_)
# Create a group (_e.g. bamboo-group_)
# Assign *user01* to *bamboo-group*.
# Grant ACCESS and CREATE permissions to *user01* under {color:blue}Bamboo administration >> Security >> Global permissions{color}.

h4. Then, as a regular user
# Select {color:blue}Create >> Create plan{color} located at the header menu.
# Select the Project you created as an admin.
# Fill in the Plan and Repository details.

# Inside the {color:blue}Configure tasks{color} screen, click on {color:blue}Cancel{color}.

You are redirected to the Build Dashboard page.

fields.description:
We have been warned from BTMU for critical Apache strut vulnerability (CVE-2017-9805, CVE-2017-9804, CVE-2017-9805 ). 

As you are aware of "Apache Struts Critical Vulnerability", All Servers with Apache Struts 2.3.x or 2.5.x. have to be patched along with Bank Policy (Critical Patch) to minimize impact of Cyber attack via vulnerabilities. Apache Struts 2 is an open-source web application framework for developing Java EE web applications. It uses and extends the Java Servlet API to encourage developers to adopt a model–view–controller (MVC) architecture. This vulnerability can let attacker to perform remote code execution attack when using REST plugin (CVE-2017-9805). From September 9, 2017

Currently we using product Bamboo version 5.11.4.1 build 51120 this version found apache struts version 2.1.8.1

We need advice and how to fix it. Or, If all issues is not vulnerable to current struts issue please confirm.
fields.summary: Apache Struts Critical Vulnerability

fields.description:
h3. Summary

(i) Example:

|| ||Old user||New user||
||Name|Bruno Rosa|Bruno Rosa|
||Username|bruno.rosa|Bruno.Rosa|

If a user/group coming from Jira/Crowd or LDAP to Bamboo gets renamed or recreated with the same name but mixed-case letters (e.g. from *bruno.rosa* to *Bruno.Rosa*) and that very same user/group had permissions assigned to it (e.g. Plan permissions, Deployment environment permissions, etc), it's not possible to remove the old user's permission from the UI anymore. Bamboo doesn't automatically cleanup permissions for a user/group that has been removed/renamed. In previous versions of Bamboo (e.g. 5.15.7) one would have to manually remove those permissions from the UI.

If you try to re-grant permissions to that user/group in an attempt to remove them again, duplicate records are generated in the database and now permissions are assigned to both of them (e.g. bruno.rosa and Bruno.Rosa) -- taking the previous example into account. However, the page will only show one entry displaying the user's name (e.g. Bruno Rosa), almost as if you didn't have two users assigned to that permission, when in fact, you have.

h3. Environment
* Bamboo 6.2.3 connected to Jira/Crowd or LDAP.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Bamboo to use Crowd as its external user management and ensure the connection/sync is working between the applications.
# Create a new user in Crowd named *bruno.rosa* and make sure it exists inside one of the directories that are sync'ed with Bamboo.
# Go to {{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Security >> User repositories}} and click _Synchronise now_ to pull the changes.
# Access the *environment permission* page from a Deployment Environment to define which users/groups are allowed to edit and view the Environment.
# Give that user *View* and *Edit* permissions.
# Go back to Crowd and rename the user to *Bruno.Rosa*.
# Go to {{Bamboo administration >> Overview >> Security >> User repositories}} and click _Synchronise now_ to pull the changes.
# Go back to the *environment permission* page to check permissions.

h3. Expected Results
* User *bruno.rosa* is not listed there anymore OR it's still listed there but can be removed using the (x) icon right next to it (this used to work in previous versions of Bamboo).

h3. Actual Results

There's still only one user listed inside the page but with *NO* level of permissions assigned to it. All check-boxes are empty for that user.

* Try removing the user and refreshing the page -- the user will continue to show up as if it didn't have permissions anymore and yet it's showing up inside the page.

* Go to the {{Add users}} field and start typing *Bruno.Rosa* -- you'll see the user in the list of options as if the user didn't have permissions already.
* Run the following SELECT statement to check what's the status of the permissions in the database for that particular Deployment Environment:
{code:sql}
select AE.*
  from ACL_ENTRY AE
  join ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY AOI
    on AE.ACL_OBJECT_IDENTITY = AOI.ID
 where AOI.OBJECT_ID_IDENTITY = '<ENVIRONMENT_ID>';
{code}
(i) Replace _<ENVIRONMENT_ID>_ with the Deployment Environment's ID -- This can be easily identified from the URL when you access the *environment permission* page.
The old permissions to user *bruno.rosa* will be there, in the database. Now if you go back to the page and try to grant the user *Bruno.Rosa* some kind of permission (e.g. View, Edit or Deploy) and re-run that SELECT query you'll see that now both *bruno.rosa* and *Bruno.Rosa* have permission to the Deployment Environment. 

h3. Notes
(!) This might also be caused by another configuration change in Crowd. It's not only a matter of renaming/recreating the user/group but if you choose the option to convert all users/groups to lower case when passing the data to Bamboo it may have the same effect, and you'll find yourself in the same situation:

!application_options.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
No workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Unable to remove permissions from user/group that got re-named or re-created with the same name but mixed-case letters

fields.description:
Problem:

Once you change a branch name or override repository settings, it's not possible to remove this override. 

Also, if you manually select the same branch name as the parent plan has (or does not change anything in the override section comparing to a master plan), it does not detect it as still persists as a separate entity. As

As a result, when the master plan is updated, the branch plan does not inherit new settings.

 

Steps to reproduce:
 * create a plan, add a local repository to the plan, select 'master' branch for it
 * create a plan branch and change the VCS branch name to 'abc', save settings
 * 
 ** you see the 'branch' icon on the right of the repo name, showing that the branch has been overridden
 * now change the VCS branch name back to 'master', save settings
 ** the 'branch' icon is still shown, despite the fact that the branch is identical
 * go to the master plan and change the 'master' to 'xyz'
 * go to plan branch, check repository
 ** the plan branch still has 'master' instead of 'xyz'; it did not detect that previous settings were identical and that it shall inherit settings from the parent

Note: the same can be achieved with the 'override' toggle.
fields.summary: It's not possible to clear repository settings override for a plan branch

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Atlassian has deprecated a feature of Plan Notifications that is necessary for our daily work.
Currently it shows the following message when the option is selected:
{quote}This notification type is obsolete and should no longer be used. Bamboo notifies Bitbucket Server about every build result automatically.{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Don't deprecate the feature

{quote}This notification option should not be considered legacy or obsolete because the BitBucket server integration does not provide the same functionality as the Stash (legacy) notification in our setup. We use Git + BitBucket for source control, and the "Git" repository type through Bamboo to clone the repos. This has the following advantages that the custom BitBucket integration lacks: 

# By configuring the Git URL, I can select SSH/HTTP/HTTPS as the protocol to clone. I conducted some ad-hoc performance tests that clearly indicated the Git + SSH clone is much faster than the BitBucket integrated repository at cloning larger repos. It becomes quite noticeable when the Git repo size starts to reach 1-10GB. I suspect the Git client does some fancy compression when using SSH.
# The Git repository configuration allows me to set the branch as a string, and I can use Plan Variables as the branch names with Customized Builds to override each repos' config on a per-build basis. I described our more complicated build setups in another bug report here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-18527. I cannot do this type of setup with BitBucket repo type. 
# The Git repository configuration allows me to set the branch using a Git tag. I cannot clone a repo from a git tag with BitBucket repo type. {quote}

h3. Workaround 
* Bitbucket Server REST API, Please [checkout this article|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/server/docs/latest/how-tos/updating-build-status-for-commits.html] on the Rest API for more details.
* With a third party plugin such as [Build Status Tracker for Bamboo|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.wittified.bamboo.embedded-build-status/server/overview] .
fields.summary: Un-deprecate Plan Notifications > Type: Stash

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no such feature in Bamboo using which we can get a complete report on user and its related permissions. For example, if we have multiple deployment projects and multiple environments in it then it is very inconvenient to get the complete reports of the permissions allocated to the users.

h3. Suggested Solution
An audit report or the API REST endpoint to get the details.
 
h3. Workaround
Execute custom SQL queries to get the results.
Refer this page for sample queries - [How to retrieve user and group access mappings/permissions from the Bamboo database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamkb/how-to-retrieve-user-and-group-access-mappings-permissions-from-the-bamboo-database-859516551.html]
fields.summary: Reports on Bamboo Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users who have a large number of rows in the database have long load times when starting Bamboo.  Part of the problem are the SQL scripts which check, and create constraints during startup.

For example:
{code:sql}
SELECT NULL                                              AS pktable_cat ,
  p.owner                                                AS pktable_schem,
  p.table_name                                           AS pktable_name ,
  pc.column_name                                         AS pkcolumn_name,
  NULL                                                   AS fktable_cat ,
  f.owner                                                AS fktable_schem,
  f.table_name                                           AS fktable_name ,
  fc.column_name                                         AS fkcolumn_name,
  fc.position                                            AS key_seq ,
  NULL                                                   AS update_rule ,
  DECODE (f.delete_rule, 'CASCADE', 0, 'SET NULL', 2, 1) AS delete_rule ,
  f.constraint_name                                      AS fk_name ,
  p.constraint_name                                      AS pk_name ,
  DECODE(f.deferrable, 'DEFERRABLE',5 ,'NOT DEFERRABLE',7 , 'DEFERRED', 6 ) deferrabilityFROM all_cons_columns pc,
  all_constraints p ,
  all_cons_columns fc,
  all_constraints fWHERE 1 = 1
AND f.table_name           = :2
AND f.owner                = :4
AND f.constraint_type      = 'R'
AND p.owner                = f.r_owner
AND p.constraint_name      = f.r_constraint_name
AND p.constraint_type      = 'P'
AND pc.owner               = p.owner
AND pc.constraint_name     = p.constraint_name
AND pc.table_name          = p.table_name
AND fc.owner               = f.owner
AND fc.constraint_name     = f.constraint_name
AND fc.table_name          = f.table_name
AND fc.position            = pc.positionORDER BY pktable_schem,
  pktable_name ,
  key_seq
{code}
  Queries against {{ALL_CONSTRAINTS}} take longer due to changes in the view definition of {{ALL_CONSTRAINTS}} in Oracle 12.1.0.2  -- DOC_ID 2266016.1



h3. Suggested Solution

Alter one of the following Session Parameters to improve performance (but not all three)
{code:sql}
ALTER SESSION SET "_optimizer_push_pred_cost_based" = FALSE;
{code}
{code:sql}
ALTER SESSION SET "_optimizer_squ_bottomup" = FALSE;
{code}
{code:sql}
ALTER SESSION SET "_optimizer_cost_based_transformation" = 'OFF';
{code}

 
h3. Workaround
wait 4-10 minutes for Bamboo to start
fields.summary: Optimize SQL queries run at startup on Oracle 12c

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to create new branches from pull requests with Bamboo Specs

h3. Environment
* Bamboo 6.2.3
* Bitbucket Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
The script used to test out the behaviour:
# created a {color:blue}PlanSpecs.java{color} with the following:
{code:java|title=PlanSpecs.java}
@BambooSpec
public class PlanSpec {
    public static void main(final String[] args) throws Exception {
        BambooServer bambooServer = new BambooServer("http://localhost:8085");
        
        Plan plan = new Plan(new Project()
                .key(new BambooKey("SPECS"))
                .name("Bamboo Specs"),
            "Temp",
            new BambooKey("TMP"))
            .enabled(false)
            .pluginConfigurations(new ConcurrentBuilds()
                    .useSystemWideDefault(false))
            .stages(new Stage("Default Stage")
                    .jobs(new Job("Default Job",
                            new BambooKey("JOB1"))
                            .tasks(new ScriptTask()
                                    .inlineBody("echo hello"))))
            .linkedRepositories("Subversion")
            
            .planBranchManagement(new PlanBranchManagement()
                    .delete(new BranchCleanup())
                    .notificationForCommitters());
        
        bambooServer.publish(plan);
        
        PlanPermissions planPermission = new PlanPermissions(new PlanIdentifier("SPECS", "TMP"))
            .permissions(new Permissions()
                    .userPermissions("admin"
                    		, PermissionType.EDIT
                    		, PermissionType.VIEW
                    		, PermissionType.ADMIN
                    		, PermissionType.CLONE
                    		, PermissionType.BUILD));
        
        bambooServer.publish(planPermission);
    }
}

                    .repositorySlug("repository")
                    .sshPublicKey("SSH_PUBLIC_KEY")
                    .sshPrivateKey("SSH_PRIVATE_KEY")
                    .changeDetection(new VcsChangeDetection()))
            
            .planBranchManagement(new PlanBranchManagement()
                    .createForPullRequest()

                    .notificationForCommitters()
                    .issueLinkingEnabled(false));
        
        bambooServer.publish(plan);
        
        PlanPermissions planPermission = new PlanPermissions(new PlanIdentifier("SPECS", "TMP"))
            .permissions(new Permissions()

                    		, PermissionType.VIEW

        bambooServer.publish(planPermission);

h2. Summary

AWS CodeDeploy task displays limited list of AWS regions

h2. Steps to Reproduce
 
 # Go to plan configuration
 # Add AWS CodeDeploy task

h2. Expected Results

Configuration will allow to use all regions where AWS CodeDeploy is supported

h2. Actual Results

Limited list of regions is displayed (eu-west-2 / London missing)

h2. Workaround

No workaround

h2. Suggested Solution

Obtain list of supported regions from [https://pricing.us-east-1.amazonaws.com/offers/v1.0/aws/AWSCodeDeploy/current/region_index.json] which will avoid a Bamboo release (and associated delay) every time AWS launch a new region.  This is a recurring issue.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Suppose if simulate AWS elastic agents feature using Docker, which allow us to easily and very quickly start new build agents it leads to a lot of offline remote agents in the Bamboo tab when the agent is offline. Currently, there is no such feature in Bamboo delete the offline agent history.
h3. Suggested Solution
Having a parameter such as {{"-Dbamboo.delete_on_disconnect=true"}} or opening a REST API Endpoint.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround for this problem except to delete the agents manually from the Bamboo UI:
* {{Bamboo Administration >> Agents >> Offline agents >> Select: All}} 
** If you have more than 50 agents, after selecting All, an additional line item will display like the below: {{All 50 agents on this page are selected. +Select all 92 offline agents+}}. 
** Clicking _Select all ## offline agents_ will select *all* your offline agents.
* Action: Delete
fields.summary: Feature to delete offline remote agents from the Bamboo history
Variables in Bamboo specs are encrypted with the same cipher

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The time taken to download an artifact within a plan using artifact download task is much slower (roughly 6 times) than the time taken for a plan from bamboo server to bamboo agent.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 * Dedicate a remote agent to a plan
 * Have a plan with an artifact download task (that downloads an artifact of size 4GB) and a script task that wgets the artifact from the Bamboo server.
 * Run the build.
 * Compare the difference in speed and duration from the build log.
 The wget task transfer speed is faster than artifact download task

h3. Suggested Solution

Artifact downloader task transfers artifacts as a compressed tar file. It would be great if we improve the implementation of this feature, so that we get a faster transfer rate.

There could be some switch to turn on or off the compression for artifact download task manually.

h3. Why this is important

When the artifact that we transfer is huge (like 4GB binary), it consumes a lot of time and contributes to the overall build time.
h3. Workaround

Use script task to wget the artifact instead of using Artifact download task.
fields.summary: Improve the transfer speed of Artifact download task and Artifact Publishing

{panel:borderStyle=dashed|borderColor=#ccc|titleBGColor=#3572B0|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#EBF2F9}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* create a user in Bamboo (e.g. {color:blue}userA{color})
* create a group in Bamboo (e.g. {color:blue}bamboo-permission{color})
* assign user to group
* create a Project (e.g. {color:blue}Project{color})

fields.description:
h3. Summary

*Plan branch >> Source repository >> Branch* dropdown not showing up in Chrome
 This problem seems to happen in 90% of the tests
h3. Environment
 * Bamboo 6.2.2
 * Bitbucket server 5.4.1
 * Chrome 62.0.3202.94 (Official Build) (64-bit)
 * Firefox 57.0 (64-bit)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a plan with Bitbucket server repository
 # Navigate to *Plan configuration >> (any plan branch) >> Source repository*

h3. Expected Results

The drop-down branch should show up as we can see in Firefox:
 !firefox_57_0.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

If we are using Chrome the drop-down is not showing up in most of the times the page is reloaded 
 !chrome_62_0_3202_94.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
If the hidden dropdown is set to a branch that no longer exists, and you override the source repository for that branch it can result in the "Could not contact the Bitbucket Server instance. This repository might not function properly" warning being displayed.

h3. Workaround

Avoid using Chrome when you need to change that field, at least until this issue is fixed

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Different problems can happen when Bamboo is running out of disk space. The error will vary depending on what part of the application is trying allocated space at the moment. This problem usually leads to a system crash and can also corrupt some files.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a report on low disk space with an email alert to admins when the server is running with less than 10% available space. This will help users to tackle this problem before the crash, allowing them to adjust their expiry settings to save some space.

h3. Possible workaround
# Create a plan for checking this information through scripting. The script should fail when the disk available space is lower than 10%. Configure the plan to notify admins when it fails. Configure the plan to have a scheduled run (once a week should be enough).
*OR*
# Configure a third party application to monitor the server partitions and notify whoever is responsible for it
fields.summary: Notify administrators when disk space runs low on Bamboo server

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's not possible to create a new linked repository from within Bamboo Specs.

h3. Workaround 
Create a linked repository manually via the UI and refer to it from Specs:
* [Bamboo Specs Reference - Plan local vs Linked Repositories|https://docs.atlassian.com/bamboo-specs-docs/latest/#plan-local-vs-linked-repositories]

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Bamboo Specs does not support final tasks for deployment environments (it does for build plans via {{.finalTasks()}}).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a final task to a Deployment Environment
# View Project as Bamboo Specs

h3. Expected Results
Final tasks are supported within Deployment projects as they are for build plans.

h3. Actual Results
The final task is flattened into the {{.tasks()}} definition. Subsequent push of the plan will result in the task no longer being final within Bamboo.

h3.Workaround
None, the task definition needs to be edited through the UI after each push to move the task to final.
fields.summary: Bamboo Specs does not support Final Tasks for Deployment Environments

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

When going to 
{noformat}
http://bamboo/deploy/viewDeploymentVersion.action?versionId={versionId}
{noformat}
Bamboo will display a list of results for that release, with the following information:
 - Environment
 - Status
 - Deployment result
 - Completed
 - Trigger

h3. Suggested solution

There is no REST call to retrieve this information. We need a call that retrieves this set of results, with at least this information.

Extra information also shown in the UI that could be useful to have:
 - Deployment project.
 - Release contents.
 - Commits

h3. Workaround

There are several different REST calls that, although they don't fit the scenario they also retrieve the same information:
{noformat}
http://bamboo/bamboo/rest/api/latest/deploy/version/{deploymentVersionId}/status
http://bamboo/rest/api/latest/deploy/project/{ProjectID}
http://bamboo/rest/api/latest/deploy/environment/{environmentId}/results
{noformat}
fields.summary: Add a REST call to retrieve release information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It would be great if there is a way of setting the quota for Bamboo, so that only a certain number of concurrent local agents can run jobs at a particular point in time. If that number of maximum running individual jobs are reached, it will not accept new ones, and queue them instead.

This is to avoid memory bottleneck.
h3. Suggested Solution

Like we have an option to assign concurrent builds, we can have an option to allocate the maximum number of builds that a local agent can run concurrently at a particular point in time.
h3. Workaround

Create a lower number of local agents and more remote and elastic agents.
fields.summary: Set an upper limit for number of jobs that can run at a point in time

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Bamboo build process hangs when [bash.exe|https://blogs.windows.com/buildingapps/2016/03/30/run-bash-on-ubuntu-on-windows/] is called from script or command task on Windows 10. It would be great if this feature is supported by Bamboo

h3. Environment
 * Windows 10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a script task
 # Choose "powershell" as interpreter and Inline as Script location
 # Add the below content
{noformat}
bash -c "ls;exit"
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The task should get successfully executed.
h3. Actual Results

The build is hung and it couldn't exit from Bash.

h3. Notes

When we run the same command from Powershell or cmd.exe, it invokes bash and exits promptly.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround for now. We have to avoid using bash.exe and run native powershell codes.
fields.summary: Run Bash on Windows via task hangs

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a plan's "Tasks" tab, we used to be able to expand the agent text where it states the number of available agents: "1 agent has the capabilities to run this job".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to "Tasks" tab in any plan
# In the top right corner, click on "X agent has the capabilities to run this job".

h3. Expected Results
The agent number has to expand and list the name of available agents that can run the job.
h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens when we click on the agent number

h3. Notes
When I inspect the element, I do see a tooltip that is expected to appear when we hover the mouse over the agent.

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: UI bug in showing available agents that has the capabilities to run a job

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, there is no such REST API using which we can get the issues list for the Bamboo release.

h3. Suggested Solution
Having a rest endpoint to get this data.
 
h3. Workaround
No workaround. Manually refer the release page in Bamboo to see the issue keys.
fields.summary: Getting issue list for Bamboo release using REST API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Assume that we have 5 remote agent licenses and we have only two plans planA and planB.
PlanA takes 2 minutes to build and PlanB takes 10 hours.

If we have only elastic agents in our setup (and no local agent or remote agent), there is a possibility that all the available elastic agents are exhausted when they all build PlanB and PlanA will be blocked in queue for hours until one of the builds get over.

h3. Suggested Solution
 If there is a possibility to dedicate elastic agents for planA, we can assign a few for those long-running plans separately, so those remaining agents are available for building PlanA.

h3. Workaround
We have to setup a remote agent or a local agent to allocate to those long running plans.
fields.summary: Possibility to set elastic agent dedicated to a plan

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The audit log events are processed by a thread that can silently fail and stop running.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(?) Using PostgreSQL to easily introduce a failure writing to the audit table
# Revoke privileges for the Bamboo database user on the audit table:
{code}
REVOKE ALL PRIVILEGES ON TABLE AUDIT_LOG FROM bamboo;
{code}
# Make a change to a plan that will be audited such as overriding concurrent max builds: *Plan Configuration >> Miscellaneous* 
# There will be an exception writing to {{AUDIT_LOG}} table
# The audit log thread will die and nothing further will log even after restoring permission:
{code}
ALTER TABLE AUDIT_LOG OWNER TO bamboo;
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON TABLE AUDIT_LOG TO bamboo;
{code}

h3. Expected Results
Audit log thread is robust and continues even after encountering an exception.

h3. Actual Results
AuditLogSaveThread is no longer running. Example of the idle thread:
{code}
"AuditLogSaveThread" #37 daemon prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fc79bb90000 nid=0x1231 waiting on condition [0x00007fc78dffa000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)
	at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)
	- parking to wait for  <0x00000000c6702bb8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:175)
	at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2039)
	at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:442)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.persister.DefaultAuditLogService$LoggerThread.run(DefaultAuditLogService.java:125)
{code}
 
h3. Workaround
Restart Bamboo
fields.summary: Improve audit log handling code

fields.description:
The publication of artifacts can fail if there is insufficient disk space. Currently this produces no explicit error message, which makes it hard to track down such an error.
h5. Steps to reproduce
 # Fill up the {{bamboo.home}} directory so there is little disk space left (this can be checked on the Bamboo "System information" page.
 # Run plan to upload a large artifact that exceeds the available disk space.

h5.  Expected results

The plan fails with an error message like "Publish artifact failed due to insufficient disk space".
h5. Actual results

Artifact publication fails with a nondescript error like the following:
{noformat}
error	20-Nov-2017 21:03:57	Unable to publish artifact [Zip files]: 
simple	20-Nov-2017 21:03:57	The artifact hasn't been successfully published after 42.10 s
{noformat}
 

Note: this was tested using a remote agent and "Bamboo remote handler" and "Server-local artifact handler" configured on the server.
fields.summary: Improve error handling when publish artifact fails due to insufficient disk space

fields.description: Branch updater will try to merge to master but will not build on the successful merge commit.
fields.summary: Branch Updater must checkout merge commit before running other build tasks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Bamboo users are unable to view the top 10 longest running tests. This feature was present in Bamboo 5.1 but removed from version 5.2.

Details on the functionality can be found in this documentation, [Viewing Test statistics for a job| https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO051/Viewing+test+statistics+for+a+job/].

h3. Suggested Solution
Restore ability to view top 10 longest running tests.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround at this time. It may be possible to retrieve this information with a database query.
fields.summary: Restore ability to view top 10 longest running tests

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set a Windows Active Directory with *MaxPageSize* set to 1000
# Make sure the AD has MORE than 1000 users
# Run an LDAP search with filter settings from *atlassian-users.xml* and save the results
# Enable the following debug in Bamboo - this will show up the filter used to get the results from AD
||Classpath|com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap|
||Type|DEBUG|
# Try to give permission to a user not returned in step 3

h3. Expected Results
Bamboo is able to find the user and the permission can be assigned

h3. Actual Results
Bamboo only returns the user if he is inside the first 1000 results returned by the default LDAP search. Bamboo runs every time a the same default search, not a restricted search depending on what the user is typing.

h3.Workaround
Reduce the number of users and groups returned using a more restricted LDAP configuration on *atlassian-users.xml*

h3. Notes
If the number of results is big (not restricted to 1000 - like the scenario, we have when using OpenLDAP, ApacheDS etc) the instance might end up with performance problems: [\[BAM\-18755\] Bamboo retrieves all users from LDAP when adding global permissions|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-18755]

If the search is restricted we will lose results as we have in the past:[\[BAM\-18051\] Bamboo does not paginate records over MaxPageSize|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-18051]
fields.summary: Unable to assign permission to some users from Active Directory

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On the *Update environment* page, we show {{\n}} at the end of the environment name

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Deployment environment, eg: "Test"
# Navigate to its Deployment project
# Click the Edit icon next to the Environment name

h3. Expected Results
The page header shows *Update environment: Test*
h3. Actual Results
The page header shows *Update environment: Test\n*
The {{atlassian-bamboo.log}} shows the following warning showing that a newline character is evaluated as part of the environment name:
{noformat}2017-11-17 19:24:29,996 WARN [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [TextProviderHelper] The first TextProvider in the ValueStack (com.atlassian.bamboo.deployments.environments.actions.ConfigureEnvironment) could not locate the message resource with key 'Update environment:                 Test
'
2017-11-17 19:24:29,996 WARN [http-nio-8085-exec-9] [TextProviderHelper] The default value expression 'Update environment:                 Test
' evaluated to 'Update environment:                 Test\n'{noformat}
fields.summary: \n appears in name of Environment on update page

fields.description:
While the XCode integration in Bamboo works great, we have one major feature request:
 * Currently, Bamboo only shows which test cases failed
 * However, it would be great if it could also show the output of each single test case (e.g. one can see from the build report which assertions failed)

While this works fine with other test reporters (junit etc.), this seems to be still lacking for XCTest.
fields.summary: Add test case output to XCTest results
